Arad, the capital and base of Arad County, is situated in the western extremity of
. The city could be considered as a tourist stopover if you are coming to
, or leaving the country. But not as a base as it lacks the same interest as other Transylvanian cities. Arad is one of the most prosperous cities in
, with a high income per capita.
Arad, a beautiful city situated in the western
on the banks of the river

, is only 30 km away from the Hungarian border. Before 1918 the city belonged to Austria-Hungary, which left a mark on its architecture and life style. Arad's city hall is a beautiful building which has to its right and left another two old palaces dating 2 centuries back. The "Cenad Palace" is one of the buildings old enough to justify the beauty of architectural times it was built in. The town has approximately 200.000 inhabitants, three quarters being Romanians and the rest is represented by Hungarians, Germans, Italians, Serbs and other minorities in smaller percentages.
is located 3 km (1.9 mi) west of the city, with flights to
Access to Arad by car is from the Pan-European corridor no.4 [E68]. Buses can be taken from

At the main train station there are services from Budapest, Praha, Warsaw, Berlin, Munich, Vienna, Venezia, Thesalonoky, Brasov, Cluj Napoca, Sibiu, Bucharest, Oradea, Timisoara, Constanta, Galati, Iasi, Baia Mare, Suceava, Craiova and Ploiesti.

Buses and trams run through the town with several stops. Taxis are available.
There are also "Rent a car" companies, one having a commercial with contact details just across the street of the Train station.

value: , every Thursday there is a classic music concert performed by the fine Arad classic music orchestra. The Museum exhibitions are open daily, except Monday.
, an area dedicated to the reconciliation between the Romanians and the Hungarians, it has two statuary complexes. Excellent for relaxing.
, situated along the shore of the Mures river, the Children's park offers an excellent way to recreate while having a nice promenade along the shore.

There are several supermarkets, hypermarkets and shopping centers like Metro, Selgros, Billa, Praktiker, Carrefour, Kaufland, Spar, Real, Profi, Penny Market, Mini Max, Bricostore, Obi, Atrium Center, Ziridava,Dedeman, etc.  Selgros and Metro require membership cards.
